node.text:
This week's #SongsWithDuo features London-based rap artist @kadiata93 singing "Happy Birthday" in Portuguese! 🥳🎂

Shoutout to Kadiata fans @sharkkana, @tenhush, and @oscarworldpeace, who have birthdays around this time. Know others with a July birthday? Tag them in the comments!

node.title: Songs With Duo, Episode 5: "Parabéns pra você"

node.text:
Remember your favorite childhood song? 🧸 🥰

This week we’re throwing it back for #SongsWithDuo! London-based musician Joviale performs “Dans la forêt lointaine” – a special song she’d sing with her younger siblings.

node.text:
Our last pre-quarantine memories were pretty sweet, huh? 💭 
For this week's #SongsWithDuo, blues musician @adiavictoria reminisces about the delicious honey she ate in Paris in a brand-new original French song, titled “Le goût du miel." 🍯 🐝

node.title: Songs with Duo, Episode 3: “Le goût du miel"

node.text:
One universal language we can all understand is music!

Each week, #SongsWithDuo will feature multilingual musicians from around the world who bring their own flair to classic and original tunes. Today, we have @milesfromkinshasa performing “Could We Just Talk Instead?”

node.title: Songs with Duo, Episode 2: "Could We Just Talk Instead?"

Share yours for a chance to be featured.

user.full_name: Le Paris Noir by Kevi Donat

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Duolingo on July 14, 2021 tagging @leparisnoir. May be a cartoon of text that says 'duolingo podcast new episode: paris noir I'.

node.text:
This Bastille Day, we’re taking une visite guidée de Paris Noir – a tour of Black Paris! 🇫🇷 

This special episode of our French Podcast features a guided audio tour through Paris to explore a unique side of the city: its Black history and culture! Join tour guide Kévi Donat (@leparisnoir) in discovering the Black thinkers, artists, and leaders who helped make Paris the city it is today. 

What are you most excited to learn about? 🤩 

Listen now at the link in our bio. Bon voyage !

node.text:

1) Doing your laundry.
2) Doing your daily lesson.

Now get to it!

Are you one of the chosen ones for the Duolingo Streak Society? This #DuoFanArt is your invitation if you have a 365 day streak or higher! 🤫 ⭐

Thanks @lydiajayneart for this motivating artwork!

Audio Lessons are now out for Spanish learners on iOS! 🎧 

These short audio-only lessons will help hone your listening and speaking skills with a hands-free experience. Find them in the headphones tab in our Spanish course (also available in our French course).

Happy listening! 💥

node.text:
Who else is learning Japanese? 🇯🇵

Thanks @staphon.art for the friendly reminder with your #DuoFanArt! ⏰

Notice something different about Bea? Check out her ✨ new✨ look! 🤩
 
In response to feedback from our Black coworkers we reevaluated Bea’s hairstyle. To better represent her identity as a Black woman, we replaced her previously ambiguous hairstyle with something that feels authentic to the community she’s a part of. 💬
 
At Duolingo, we believe representation is an evolving process that requires empathy, refinement, and action. We won’t always be 100% on the dot, but we’re always working to be better and do better. 💪
 
To create in-app experiences that are true to who our learners are, we work with our employees of different backgrounds as well as sensitivity readers to help ensure we’re doing right by our community to the best of our ability. 💚 📱
 
Keep an eye out for Bea’s fresh, amazing new look – coming soon to Duolingo lessons, Stories, and everywhere else she appears! 🌍 👀
